# Doctoral Programme

BRIC-National Institute of Immunology offers rigorous long-term research training leading to the award of a Ph.D. degree of the Regional Centre for Biotechnology (RCB),Faridabad, Haryana. Applications for the Ph.D. program are invited from candidates aspiring for a scientific career in biological and related sciences. NII admits Ph.D. candidates twice each year, during the winter and monsoon sessions.

A detailed announcement describing the selection procedure for admission to the Ph.D. program is displayed on the Institute's website and advertised in national newspapers and the Employment News. Applications for the winter session (beginning in January) are invited in August/September, while applications for the monsoon session (beginning in July) are invited in February/March. Around 25 to 30 scholars are admitted to the program annually, selected based on their performance in a national-level competitive written examination followed by interviews of shortlisted candidates.

The minimum academic qualifications required are M.Sc. or equivalent in any branch of science, M.Tech., MBBS, M.Pharm., or equivalent qualification recognized by RCB, Faridabad, Haryana.

Candidates interested in pursuing research toward their Ph.D. in broad interdisciplinary research areas of Immunology, Infectious and Chronic Disease Biology, Molecular and Cellular Biology, Chemical Biology, Structural Biology and Computational Biology are invited to submit applications.

# Post-Doctoral Programme

Research programmes in various laboratories of NII are supported by a large number of extra-mural grants. The programmes provide opportunities for students who have a Ph.D. degree to work as Post-doctoral fellows. The positions are advertised on the website of the institute and candidates are selected on the basis of an interview. These projects are temporary in nature and governed as per instituteâ€™s norms and terms set by the funding agency. The performance of the fellow is reviewed every year for continuation in the programme.

# Short-Term Training

The National Institute of Immunology provides opportunities for outstanding students to carry out project work under the supervision of the Instituteâ€™s scientists towards partial fulfilment of their degrees (of at least SIX monthsâ€™ duration; session I: July-December; session II: January-June).

The minimal eligibility criterion for consideration of the requests is first division or an equivalent grade (or at least 60% of aggregate scores) in all major examinations starting from the secondary school examination onwards. The following procedure should be followed by interested students:

Only students who are currently pursuing a Master's degree (e.g. MSc, MVSc, MTech, integrated masters students in their last year etc.) may apply for the six-month project training. Those who have already completed their Masterâ€™s degree are not eligible.

Students currently perusing final year of their four-year (8-semester) graduation degree (BE/B.Tech) may also apply.

The requests must be forwarded through the Heads of Departments and must provide the academic resumes of the recommended student(s), clearly specifying percentage marks obtained at various levels and the subjects covered, as well as the period of proposed project work.

Every department can forward a maximum of two requests.

Applicants must mention their broad area of interest from the following subjects:

a) Immunity and Infection

b) Genetics, Cell Signalling and Cancer Biology

c) Chemical Biology, Biochemistry and Structural Biology

d) Computational Biology, Bioinformatics and AI/ML applications in biology.
